newsitem.title: USA: J.C.Penney charged with credit violations.
newsitem.headline: J.C.Penney charged with credit violations.

text.p: The Federal Trade Commission said Tuesday it has charged J.C. Penney Co. Inc. with violating consumers' right to receive written notice of the reason for a denial of credit.
J.C. Penney, one of the nation's biggest retailers, agreed to pay a $225,000 civil penalty to settle the case, the FTC said.
Also, the company will be required to give consumers who were denied credit in the past a written statement of the reason for the denial, the FTC said.
The company must comply with such explanation requirements in future, the agency said.
A consent decree between the company and the FTC is for settlement purposes and does not constitute an admission of a law violation, the agency said.
The FTC alleged that when J.C. Penney denied consumer credit in the past, it either failed to explain the reason or gave the wrong reason.
J.C. Penney's stock fell 12.5 cents to $56.125 on the New York Stock Exchange in early afternoon trading.
